inn1.comm: swing again, touch shorter of a length and again Guptill flags it through
better ball here, forces Guptill to play from a fuller length. Again some swing but easily pushed away
excellent, searching start from Malinga. Drive-me length but swing away keeps Guptill careful
first boundary of the semi-finals! And in good style too. Malinga drifts too straight onto the pads and Guptill picked it up, flicking to the midwicket boundary with excellent timing. Good sign there
just the one bad stray delivery in the over then as Malinga finds the right length and line again
this is slow off the wicket and McCullum mistimes an attempted cut shot, bottom edging into the off side
ah, top shot this. McCullum jumps deep into his crease and thumps a short ball over midwicket for four
much better delivery and the response is duly respectful from McCullum
full toss but McCullum fails to take advantage. Tapping to cover instead of smashing it out the ground
fuller ball finds a full face as  Guptill pushes down the ground and scoots off for a single
resolute and steady defence to end the over. Good start for New Zealand then. Better than England managed against Dilshan in the quarters on this ground
oh dear, Murali's dive at short midwicket is very ginger. Doesn't get near the ball as a leg-side delivery is flicked around the corner
better line, finding off stump on a length and Guptill defends calmly
again the line drifts a touch leg side and Guptill turns it into the leg side, timing it slightly better than he imagined which allowed him to come back for a swift couple
better length, touch shorter and pushed to short midwicket. Keeper up to the stumps, by the way. Fair to say the pitch isn't a flier
tight line around off stump and duly defended
best delivery of the over, classic one-day medium pace. Sliding into the batsman and almost squeezing through on a good length
Herath loops this up a touch and finds some spin as a result. Quietly defended
hint of false shot as some spin finds the outer half of the bat
slider, slightly quicker and McCullum hurries his defence
spin! Proper turn here squared McCullum up. Herath holding it back a touch and finding good purchase as a result
much quicker here and McCullum jabs down in a rush
excellent over, maiden no less. Finishes with some spin again nothing for McCullum to get hold of
Guptill steers a drive towards point who threatens a misfield before gathering. Almost sold a dummy to the batsman but they declined to run
uppish but powerful! That's Guptill's area. Full-face check-drive down the ground, races to the rope. Quality shot
having taken the boundary this can be happily defended
again shapely textbook defence
very tight line around middle, the length is too short for Guptill to drive so he nudges to leg
just the boundary from the over then as Guptill defends to finish
wow, McCullum has got plenty of this! Herath tosses one up and McCullum thrust down a pad and swung his lines through a sweep to send it scattering the crowds over deep square
after that shot Herath is quicker and McCullum blocks
touch wide this time and the attempted chop is mistimed
huge appeal as McCullum is struck on the back pad around off stump. Very close indeed but Dar decided not out and replays show it only grazing off stump
careful defence this time
the shot deserved a boundary but long-off is straight enough to dive and save on the rope. It was driven with a perfectly-straight bat, on the up down the ground
for no real reason McCullum gets in a tangle defending this off the front foot
well, you'll like this then, Geoff. McCullum opens the face to steer a square drive into space
and more singles for Geoff as Guptill pushes down to long-on
the attempted square drive finds point which denies the chance of another this-one's-for-Geoff single
good line from Matthews, very straight and a firm drive finds mid-on
here is the square drive again, beats a diving Dilshan at point
gone now! The heave-ho sweep which worked so well last over is missed as Herath slips in quicker ball under the bat. Clips off stump and Herath punches the air!
Ryder is away straight away, easing his ample weight back and clipping through midwicket
big spin for Herath here. Touch of bounce too but it's slow off the pitch and Guptill has time to defend
more air on this and Guptill pushes a single down the ground
Ryder stretches forward to very respectfully defend outside off stump
touch of spin to end an excellent, wicket-taking over. He's varied things nicely and Ryder has to get his eye in
Guptill has looked in good order so far today. He's back on his straight drive and earns a single to long-on
width to Ryder is normally bad news for the bowler but Matthews gets away with this as it's toe-ended to cover
okay, so the after-eight-overs pitch assessment is that it's er, fairly slow. A straight drive finds mid-off without much timing
touch slower here, Ryder almost got in trouble be flicking across the line but saw it just in time
ah that is the slow pitch working it's menace. Ryder scoops an uppish drive wide of cover
again Ryder stands very still, just transferring his weight to push away
starts straight, he's always straight. Guptill flashes a drive straight to cover
this is heading to middle before Guptill eases into line to block
nicely done from the batsman, playing it late and straight down the ground
ooh, Ryder misreads this and plays outside of it a fraction as it spins back to him. Went uppishly back to Mendis
slightly quicker here and Ryder pops forward to defend
very straight ball finds a very straight bat
very straight from Matthews and Guptill aims an on-drive down the ground
up and around off stump, sliding back in a fraction. Ryder defends
a hint outside off stump and Ryder is again careful  in defence
Ryder's patience is just being tested here. Gets something approaching a half-volley and he slaps to mid-off. Can't time it thanks to it dragging off the pitch a touch
ooh, something had to give and Ryder's flash found an outside edge that sped through a vacant slip area
nicely done from Guptill here, taking a full ball from around off stump and flicking a couple to midwicket, like a very, very downmarket Viv Richards

wonderful shot, that will release the pressure on Ryder. Too short from Mendis and it sat up asking for trouble, the key was for Ryder to wait and wait he did, before cracking a cut shot wide of point for four
boundary followed by an inside-edge to midwicket
carom-ball is watchfully  defended back to the bowler
Mendis is too short again, touch too wide as well and Guptill helps himself to a chop behind square for a couple
more air on this and good line too. Very carefully blocked
Guptill loves it on his pads, clips around the corner to bring up the New Zealand fifty. Decent start for New Zealand, the innings is brewing nicely
Matthews continues and Guptill's full-face, in-the-V drive is unfurled again. Just for a single though because long-on is in place
wristy, open-face steer sends this down to third man
another open face, much slower ball and Guptill had to wait in position for a late cut for a long, long time before it slides off the face
Matthews is bowling offspinners here! Tossed up and cutting away, Ryder has to drive in slow motion
four more! Top work from Ryder, offered some width and Ryder eases his arms gently through the ball sending it over cover and speeding to the rope
too wide again from Matthews, but it's closer to a yorker length so Ryder can't get the elevation he got last time
Mendis slides this back into Guptill, up and around off stump coming back in
last one in, this one out. Blocked quietly
excellent line and length, which added to all the variation means Guptill is very watchful
this spun neither in nor away and was dragged a touch too short which allowed Guptill to squeeze a drive away
Ryder stretches forward to defend. Moves his feet to the spinners much more than the quicks. Which makes sense
not sure Ryder knows what Mendis is up to. He's very cagey in defence
creaks up to the stumps, lands it on a perfect length and line and Guptill clips to leg
plenty of air on this and Ryder squeezes a drive to deep cover
this starts leg side and spins further. Clipped a pad though so no wide
lovely air and line but not quite yet fizz off the pitch of old so easier to defend
again the line is very good so even with no spin careful defence
very accurate over to begin as Guptill blocks again
ooh, some bite here. Quicker and spinning away. Ryder steers wide of slip
slightly fuller which means Ryder is more comfortable pushing this wide of point
dragged a touch short but only singles available at the moment as Guptill hops back to punch to deep point
this spins away from a length, just enough for Ryder to mistime his drive
again nothing on offer for Ryder. New Zealand slowing down now
solid and steady defence but Sri Lanka won't mind
clipped away from a full length into the leg side
bottom edge breaks the shackles, at least for a moment. Slips under Jayawardene and heads off towards third-man
steady blocking to a fuller ball
Guptill clips a single into space
Ryder finds short cover with a well-timed drive. Just gave himself a bit of room
more resolute blocking. Murali has started well, better than against England, so perhaps the injury is wearing off
ooh, good move putting in a silly mid-on, this bobbles up one-bounce to the new man
clipped firmly but straight to the newly-positioned man. Could cut off Guptill's escape shot
two spin in and this one goes away, past a groping outside edge
wonderful bowling again, nothing for Guptill to work with
suddenly things are closing in on these two batsman. Feels like there are fielders everywhere
this will do nicely, Guptill dropping into the off side and haring off for a single
tucked to wide midwicket, just the one
a meaty thump goes straight to short extra cover

gone this time! Ryder was lining up a similar shot, looking to power it away through the off side. A touch of extra bounce on the delivery, it fairly took off outside off, and a thin edge nestles safely in Sangakkara's gloves. Sri Lanka are ecstatic, they've got this match by the scruff of the neck now
Murali stays round the wicket to Taylor, and this one rushes on and bounces too. Taylor biffs uppishly down to long-on to get off the mark
Guptill shuffles across to off and nudges into the leg side for a single, playing across the front pad
a touch too full, driven down to long-on
flighted up on middle, breaking away, defended back down the track
and again, this time Taylor tries to nudge wide of the bowler but there's no single as Herath rushes across
flatter this time on off stump, the ball spins away and Taylor chops to point
now he finds one, Taylor stoops to sweep and sends the ball down to fine leg
solid defence from Guptill, coming forward
flicked through the vacant square leg, Sangakkara hares after the ball as the batsmen set off. Just the one
offspinner, going down the leg side but it clips the pad on the way through .. or did it? That's called wide
a touch short, Guptill steps back and slams it back to the bowler
looped up beautifully on middle, Guptill stretches forward in defence
half an appeal as Guptill takes one on the pad, but that was optimistic
again just a little short on middle and off, Guptill swipes down to long-on for one
edged! That looked like the doosra, the ball took a thick edge and rolled away down to third man. No slip in place, just the silly mid-off
pushed defensively into the covers, another good over

that does swing! Wobbling through the air at good pace, reversing in. The ball comes off the toe, going straight into the ground and bouncing away down to third man. He was aiming for the yorker first up
very full again, dug out just wide of the mid-off fielder, who runs round to cut it off

unplayable! A searing inswinging yorker bursts through Guptill and makes a mess of the stumps. He may well have been expecting that after watching the first two deliveries, but it didn't appear to make much difference. He was in too, but that was just too good. The slinger strikes!
just kept out! Styris was surely expecting the yorker, but that wasn't convincingly played at all. Still, he did just enough to keep it out
Malinga follows that up with a bouncer, it's dug in at a decent pace but loops harmlessly over the batsman
full again, not quite the yorker and Styris drives powerfully straight back towards the bowler, who stoops in his follow-through to lay a hand on the ball and save runs
Taylor stretches forward and nudges cautiously behind square
offspinner, pushed to midwicket
fuller, Taylor drives back to the bowler
this time Taylor stays deep in the crease, flicking to midwicket again

dangerous shot! Taylor makes room as Murali spears one down quicker on off stump, chopping it down at the very last moment. The ball could easily have crashed into off stump there, definitely not short enough for the shot
punched to mid-off, Taylor searches for the single but there's none to be had
slower ball from Malinga, not sure if Styris quite picked it but it slipped out as a full toss and the batsman manages to clip into the leg side
full of length outside off, Styris steps forward and angles the drive down to third man
length again from Malinga, sitting up outside off as Taylor flashes hard at it. The ball bounces down to third man's right for two
reverse swing, nice and full but not the yorker. Taylor drives just wide of a deep mid-on and they charge through for one
how has that been kept out? Another fantastic inswinging yorker, Styris jams the bat down in hope and the ball bobbles into the leg side
more reverse, from a full length but not the yorker to finish. This snaked in quite viciously through the air, and Malinga has his hands on his head as Styris nudges to midwicket
starts with a very loopy one on middle, driven down to long-on
tossed up wide of off, Styris drives well but straight to the cover fielder
another good-looking shot, this time it's intercepted at midwicket however
just a little too full from Dilshan, and Styris is able to pick up one down to long-on
flighted once again, Taylor whips across the front pad at the last moment to pick up one through square leg
slapped back to the bowler, and a dot ball to finish
slung down full on off stump, Taylor chops it hard into the ground and the ball bounces up to cover
superb yorker, Styris is operating with an almost Collingwood-esque low backlift though, and he's able to keep it out
Malinga errs slightly with his length, and a half-volley is driven hard out to deep cover boundary. Great timing
on the toe! Another hooping yorker, slipping towards leg stump and Styris finds a way to keep it out
full of length, driven to mid-off

shot! Styris is quick to seize on another half-volley as Malinga misses his mark witht the yorker, and he unfurls a fine straight drive that beats the bowler, scoots past the stumps, and races to the straight boundary
Dilshan slips one down the leg side, that's wide
much better line, tossed up outside off and Taylor leans forward to defend
defend turn for Dilshan when he flights it, this one breaks from off stump and takes Taylor on the pad, rolling into the leg side. No lbw shout, was definitely slipping down leg
nice little paddle-sweep from Taylor, and they take two before the fielder can run round and hurl the ball back in
worked with a wristy bottom hand to midwicket, straight to the fielder
slightly too straight from Dilshan, Taylor is able to flick through square leg
speared in slightly flatter, Styris nudges into the leg side to the right of the midwicket fielder, creating an opportunity for a single
huge shout first ball as Styris, who is in a cap now, misses a sweep and is struck on the pad. Hitting outside off though, no review called for
defended to cover
loopy full toss, wide of off, and Styris misses the drive ... that looked like Herath's variation, the one he flicks out that spins the other way - carrom ball
full again, he adjusts his line well and Styris drives back to the bowler
driven down to long off
Taylor hangs back and punches, Herath dives but can't stop it and they take one as the ball rolls down to long off
nudged just wide of midwicket, they steal another quick single
worked easily down to long-on
drop-and-run as Taylor just places the ball to backward point and they take off
flat on off stump, Styris defends
Styris steps back and pushes to long-on for another single
tapped gently into space in the covers, another single
Styris flicks across the front pad, the ball goes to the left of the short fine leg fielder and they sprint through
flat on off stump, whipped straight to the midwicket fielder
breaking in a touch, but too short and Styris is able to ease it down to long-on
again this one comes in a touch, nudged to the left of the midwicket fielder for one
Styris cautiously defends to that very fielder that's just come in
outside off, Styris watches it carefully and plays it late through gully
worked defensively into the leg side
tossed up high on leg stump, the ball almost lands on Taylor's toe as he flicks to short fine leg
better length, not quite as full and Taylor taps to the bowler
this time Taylor tries to work it wider to beat Murali, but midwicket rushes across and dives to stop the single
offspinner, landing outside off and driven carefully to long-off
another offspinner, this one breaks quite sharply and Styris flicks to the left of the short fine leg fielder. They sprint through for one
this one rushes straight on, and is met with a forward defensive
he starts with a slower ball, an offcutter, and Styris steps forward to drive to cover
quicker this time, again Styris drives and this time he middles it ... but a diving cover fielder cuts it off. Good effort
bouncer on off stump, but Styris picked it early and pulled in front of square, rolling his wrists to keep the ball down, and reaches the deep midwicket boundary
good comeback from Malinga, another slower ball and Styris only seemed to pick it at the last moment, laying bat on ball to defend to cover
good, reversing yorker but it's on a leg stump line and Styris is able to glance it out into the deep ... and they're back for the second

half-volley from Malinga, and Styris meets it with a glorious, flowing cover drive to pick up four more! Second boundary of the over, and New Zealand are fighting back into a good position. That takes the partnership to 50
dropped close in on the leg side, short fine leg runs in but he can't stop the single
Murali stays round the wicket, tossing one up outside off. Styris defends
a sharply spinning offbreak clips the pad and rolls to fine leg
Taylor tries to nudge to fine leg, but the fielder rushes across to cut it off
quicker, flatter, and Taylor defends
flatter again, chopped down behind gully for one
full and straight and lurking swing back into the batsman who digs it out
full and swinging in again, you know what's coming, just the playing it bit that's harder
slower ball almost gets the better of Taylor, who adjusts late but not enough to prevent a slight leading edge that squirts to cover
Styris grits his teeth and jabs out another searing yorker towards cover
just two deliveries left before the ball changes and the swing goes away. Styris calmly blocks to long-on
sturdy defence to finish. Could be Malinga's spell I reckon
Herath tosses this up around off stump, that man Styris pushes towards cover
Taylor is very calm so far in defence
Herath's line is good, the length isn't bad either and Taylor so far is playing him from the crease
a single pushed down the ground brings Styris back on strike
full-faced punch down the ground. Just a single again
careful and uneasy defence from Taylor. He hasn't looked fluent yet
starts with a finger-spun leggie, touch short, Styris hangs back to cut but it slides past the edge
ah lovely shot, couple of steps down the track, meets it on the half-volley and crashes it down the ground for four
boundary is followed up by a open-faced steer
more careful defence from Taylor
this is held back a fraction and a neat flick of the wrists sends it around the corner
good over for New Zealand ends with a clip down the ground. Styris has such a grizzly look in his eye. Rightly so, he seems well up for it
no problems for Styris, who hops down the wicket and pushes a milked single to long-on
smart diving work from Dilshan off his own bowling saves the single
this time Taylor beats the bowler by pushing wide of him and jogging through
classic middle-over batting as Styris stands tall to punch a single to long-on
Taylor tries to steer a delicate cut behind point but instead finds the man. Manages to scoot through for a single anyway
Styris fails to beat the bowler so Dilshan's two dot balls makes it a good over for Sri Lanka
Taylor is completely stuck against Mendis. No risk cricket and not much reward either

the bowler loses his line and a good shot from Taylor here, crouching low to tickle a sweep shot around the corner. Deserved four but a full-length sliding stop by Matthews on the boundary prevents it
plenty of air from Mendis and it creeps off the pitch. Styris had his bat in line for a long time before it hit
again Styris is very careful in defence
useful for New Zealand here, too short and Styris chops behind point for a couple more
confident, full-face drive ends a decent over for New Zealand
crashing drive finds a diving Dilshan, who creates all kinds of excitement by taking a crowd catch
this time the drive is wider and heads out to deep cover
driven out to deep extra this time
Dilshan fields oddly this time, parrying an awkward bounce at mid-off. On second viewing that's actually a great piece of fielding because the ball hit a divot and leapt
pressure pinning onto New Zealand again now as Styris defends
again Dilshan is in the action, fielding smartly to save a single. The next over needs to be a good one for New Zealand or something will give

Taylor's struggle ends. You felt something was coming. In the end it's a poor delivery, dragged short that Taylor pulled straight down the throat of deep midwicket. Normally you'd back Taylor to clear that boundary but he's not quite found his range today
very straight-batted and correct defence as Mendis again locates an ideal line
little bit short from Mendis, the line is still good though. Williamson stands up on his toes and pushes down to long-on to get off the mark
pushed away carefully into space
pitch is certainly slowing down but New Zealand need more than the 230 they are heading for. Williamson flips a single around the corner
quicker and flatter to end the over. Steered wide of point to swap the strike
10 overs to go and Styris begins the charge by defending back to the bowler
this time the delicate drive is wide of the bowler and Styris collects a very well-complied 50
Williamson pops this into the off side and steals a tight single that has Styris sprawling over the line, flat on his face and covered in dirt
pushed down the ground firmly
Williamson finds some space to squeeze a cut behind point

careful defence to end the over. These two can probably 'just bat', as the clichÃ© goes, for another three or four overs before beginning the charge. That said, swatting Malinga for many at the death is not straightforward
starts full, too full, straight though and Williamson's drive is rather pitiful. No power, no timing, no runs

absolute suicide from Williamson. Well, not absolute because he's got the run. Terrible mix-up though. Williamson pushed a limp drive straight to Jayawardene at mid-off  but the shy was wide of the stumps and Malinga wasn't even near the stumps to take the bails off
quietly turned into the leg side for a more secure single
how about that!? Where did it come from? Gloucester fans will be cheered. Williamson picked it up from a length and clipped it over midwicket for four!
waist-high full-toss, Williamson backed away and somehow managed to spoon it over cover and speed off for runs. It's actually waist-high, according to the umpire, and a no ball!
better delivery here, full and straight and carefully defended
so a good over for New Zealand in the end, Williamson backs away and pushes a drive to cover
Murali begins his new spell by floating up a full ball that is carefully pushed for a single down the ground
this is flatter and spins sharply enough to make Williamson uncomfortable in defence
wonderful shot! Shot of the day I reckon! Williamson dances down the track and gives himself room to unfurl a very controlled, chip-drive over mid-off and it speeds away for four
four more! Too short, really sat up and Williamson hopped back and chopped a cut shot firmly behind point
this time it's flipped to leg but straight to the man
this spins back a long way but Williamson was quick enough on his feet to get outside the line and give himself room to squeeze a back-foot drive
brilliant stop from Jayawardene at mid-off saves a boundary. It was a quality shot from Williamson driving hard but somehow it was stopped with a full-length dive
clipped into the midwicket region this time
Malinga works the magic again! Full, swinging in and struck bang in front! The sort of lbw you would walk from. Absolutely plumb. Very good little innings that and now the power hitters can come in.
very full, low full-toss in fact, swinging in again and McCullum can only defend
nowhere for McCullum to go. Inch-perfect yorker jabbed to cover
excellent slower ball to finish a brilliant death over. Really such high class and punctures the atmosphere New Zealand were creating for themselves
Murali is struggling a bit here, spins the down the leg side it flicks a pad and runs away towards the fine leg rope. Valuable runs and now McCullum gets another go to find his range
this finds the pads again, but straighter as McCullum defends
very neatly done, soft hands prods into the leg side and McCullum hares off for two. He's not tried anything expansive yet
more very cagey defence
top shot! Brilliant strength, McCullum skips down, opens his body and with flick of the wrists pings it over mid-on and it keeps travelling, all the way for six!
boundary followed by a tickle for a single. Murali has gone for 22 from 2 Powerplay overs here

Malinga is such a demon at the end of an innings. Brilliant variations! McCullum stepped down looking to heave to leg, slight slower ball meant he was through the shot too early and found a faint top edge
swinging low full-toss to greet the new batsman. Oram opens the face to steer behind square but picks out point
full toss again, clipped straight to midwicket, Oram makes a tight single easy by virtue of his enormous strides
slower ball that Styris slugs down the ground. He's hardly had any strike of late
not quite the big heave to the boundary but an outside edge will do! Full and a half-open-face half-edge scoots off to the third man boundary
excellent slower yorker to finish that Oram carefully digs out back to the bowler
starts with a very short ball that Styris steers to third man
Oram gets forward very respectfully in defence
slightly cumbersome sweep around the corner earns a tight single
this spins from leg too far down the leg side
Styris nudges this to leg. He's not going to go too early here
again it's nudged to leg, Oram hares halfway up the crease before heading back

on his last delivery in Sri Lanka Murali strikes! Key wicket as well! Styris gets deep into his crease to work to leg, missed it and was trapped in front. Styris reviews but it's clipping leg stump. What a wonderful, who-writes-your-scripts? exit from his home stage! Massive cheer from the crowd as the decision is finally confirmed!
this is pushed away carefully, New Zealand desperately in need of a crescendo
Vettori gets low and sweeps awkwardly for a tight single
Oram picks out point with firm cut shot. The net is closing around Oram

gone this time! Oram had to try something, ended up heaving high towards long-on who jogged in a few yards off the rope, steadied himself and held the chance. New Zealand's chances of posting something competitive are sliding away
Vettori works to the leg side to bring Southee, who really can hit a long ball, onto strike. Trouble is New Zealand are in danger of being bowled out
what an excellent over from Dilshan, just three runs and a wicket. 12 balls to go...
Vettori again on an awkward sweep, bounced a touch more than he expected and ended up shovelling towards midwicket
big spin this away from the bat, Southee looks curiously at it and can only poke to cover
Southee gone now, things sliding away in a hurry. Spun away again and Southee was very tentative, prodding at the ball, faint outside edge and Sangakkara does the rest
goodness, by the looks of things McKay is no No. 12. Gropes aimlessly at this as it sneaks past the edge

all over in a heap for New Zealand. Innings end with a four for four collapse as McKay prods hopelessly and misses. Murali waves his cap to the crowds as he leads Sri Lanka off, they'll hope not to see him later!

inn2.comm: tossed up outside off and sharp turn away from Tharanga who pushes off the front foot
straighter and lesser turn as he spears it in from an angle, defended down the track

aha, here we go! Tharanga's not waiting too long today. He's not planning to let Dilshan steal the thunder. He's jumped out to the third ball, got to the flight and launched it straight back over the bowler's head. Top shot.
he's firing them in fast and flat, Tharanga defends from the crease to the off side
similar ball, straightens from middle, played into the off side
ooh, early into lazy defensive push as Nathan lands this on a length outside off, uppish as Tharanga takes the top hand off a touch late. Past the man at silly point.
good start, nice length half a foot outside off and lovely shape away from Dilshan who lets it go to the keeper.
half an appeal. Southee lands this on middle and gets it to straighten, but not enough to hit the stumps. Dilshan tries to work to the leg side from the crease and it hits him high over the pads.
good length ball on off, again hinting at away movement, Dilshan eases into a check drive wide of mid off for a single
short of a length on middle and leg, Tharanga tucks it off the front foot to the man close in on the leg side

shot of a man in the form of his life. That ball seemed destined for the cover boundary the moment Southee released it. Everything happened in slow motion, almost inevitably. It landed on a friendly length outside off, Tharanga got that front foot forward and across decisively to the pitch and then smoked it through the line. Clinical.
this is not the way New Zealand began the other night. Horror ball, lands well outside leg and swings further. Baz does well to get a glove on it, else this was five wides.

shot of the day. Tharanga gives the bat-maker nice coverage on prime-time television. Back of a length ball angling across at the low 130s, Tharanga gets half across and spanks it on the rise to the left of mid off, and then holds the pose as the ball purrs away. That's his 50th four in this World Cup and he's the first to get there.
flat delivery on middle and breaking in, Dilshan works it with the turn to the leg side for no runs
smartly bowled from round the wicket, full and drifting away from Dilshan who has to adjust after reaching across. He opens the face and dabs to point for a single.
fullish ball on leg, Tharanga defends from the crease.
he's not very keen to spend much time inside the crease. Tharanga gambols out, Nathan keeps it short of a length and Tharanga still scythes it with the spin towards wide mid off
the compensation, Nathan drops too short and Tharanga has too much time on his hands to place it well. He cuts straight to cover.
over-pitched on leg stump, Tharanga squeezes it out to the leg side of the pitch
full delivery on leg stump from round the wicket, Tharanga smashes the flick off the meat of the bat, but he can't get it past the prowler at midwicket. Who else but Marty Guptill.
elegant. Vettori lands it on that searching length outside off and Tharanga laces it with supreme timing, against the spin through the covers for a couple.
loopy delivery, straight on the leg stump and Tharanga plays it back to the bowler
flatter and angling across, Tharanga stays back and defends to the leg side
fired in at 98 kph on leg stump, Tharanga turns it around to square leg for one
armer from round the wicket, Dilshan hangs back and punches against the angle into the covers
flat delivery outside leg from round the wicket, worked to the leg side off the back foot
lands outside leg and turns further down the leg side, worked with the spin to the leg side as Dilshan fidgets out of the crease.
gets the single this time, playing a flat ball on leg stump to mid on for one
slower through the air to Tharanga, who stays in the crease this time and defends down the pitch.
nice delivery, back of a length outside off and breaking away, Tharanga is forced to drive a little away from his body to mid off

Sri Lanka are off to a nice and easy start here. Tharanga's danced out of the castle and propelled a tossed up ball to the extra cover boundary. He really ensures he gets to the pitch once he jumps out, but this time he went a little uppish with the shot. The placement was good though, landing short and wide of the diving fielder at mid off. He would have had to be twice as tall as Jacob Oram and twice as fast as Martin Guptill to get to that.
Dilshan furiously punches against the spin towards cover point for one
back of a length, coming into Tharanga leaving him with no room to play through the off side, but he somehow manages to get it away through the covers for two more.
aha, Vettori gets one to bounce extra from a full length outside off as Tharanga looks to steer from the crease.
short of a length on leg stump, Tharanga tries to work it with the spin but can't get it away off the pads.
searching delivery outside off, met decisively by a lunging Tharanga who gets another single into the covers
flat delivery on off stump to the end the over, Dilshan cracks it with ugly efficiency through point for one
aha, Dilshan looks to sweep a full ball on leg stump but can't get bat on it.
flat delivery on leg stump, worked with the spin to the leg side.

if Dilshan doesn't get you, Tharanga will. Nathan's missed the length by an inch, and the line by lesser, but somehow Tharanga converts a potential length ball on off stump into a half-tracker outside off, and he's then powered it through point with a comprehensive cut. Nathan grimaces, he knows how less the margin of error is now.
on the pads this time, Tharanga quietly stays back and tucks to mid on for a single
flat delivery on the pads to end the over, Dilshan works it with the spin to square leg

well done, Brendon. Bouncer from Southee, over-cooked and banged into his own half, it goes well over the batsman's head and Brendon takes off to collect it over his head. And its not called a wide. Even in the moon, given the lack of gravity there, that should have been wide.

Ryder take a bow! Even fat men can fly says George Binoy! This Kiwi sure can fly. Was that Jesse Ryder or Jesse Owens? Here's what happened - it was a short ball outside off, enough width and room for Tharanga in his current form to flay at. Enough room for him to try and go aerial. Ryder was lurking at point. He moved quickly to his left, took off with as much grace as he is capable of and landed with a resounding thud. In the meantime, he caught the ball. And then he stood up with arms aloft, menacing beard and frown in place, like a WWE superstar. What a moment!
aha, inside edge first up. The air is thick again. Sanga somehow gets it past the stumps to the leg side for a single.
ah, Southee's trying too hard. He's speared an intentional dream legcutter without any movement, too full and on the pads. Dilshan thumps it off the pads through midwicket.
short of a length on off stump, Dilshan stays back and carves with all the finesse you would expect from a giraffe composing a sonata. Single into the covers.
fuller ball on off stump, Sanga gets half forward and defends towards point
back of a length and angling into the pads, Dilshan looks to flick but can't time it.
loud appeal, but very optimistic as Oram sends in another nagging offcutter than hits the pad on its way down the leg side
length ball on off stump, played into the covers off the front foot
this is pretty good stuff from Oram. 125 kph on off stump and coming in with angle, Dilshan defends respectfully.
another one that comes in with a huge angle from wide of the crease, and some extra bounce too to take Dilshan by surprise as he tries to force into the off side
top-notch over. Ends with a fullish ball coming into middle and leg, catches Dilshan on the move as he tries to flick.
length ball from Southee on off stump, Sanga defends carefully
on the pads, Sanga stays back and clips through midwicket for a single.
length ball, comes in and cramps Dilshan who defends against the angle into the off side
back of a length outside off, Dilshan jumps back and forces into the covers

aha, Southee gets the bouncer on target this time and Dilshan was caught amidships. Short, fast and aimed at the helmet. Dilshan was expecting a fuller ball, and then had to hurry onto the back foot. Dilshan being Dilshan, he even tried to pull it away, but missed. It grazed the helmet on the way to the keeper.
short of a length ball on off stump, Dilshan gets a half stride in and defends into the covers.

where is slip? Sanga is let off, as Oram gets another one to nip away off the seam and he is sucked into a loose cover drive. The ball duly takes the edge and flies fine, but Baz is standing up and the slip is not there.
back of a length on leg stump, Sanga covers the line and defends to the leg side
fuller length, angling across and Sanga pushes with the angle to the off side
full length ball on leg stump, Sanga works it off the toes to the leg side.
short of a length and angling across, Sanga opens the face and steers to point
back of a length delivery outside off, this is a watchful start from Sanga as he steers past point for a single.
short of a length ball outside off, Dilshan stays on the crease and plays into the off side
he's not giving Dilshan anything to drive and Dilshan is getting fidgetty. He stays on the crease and flays the bat at a delivery that's short of a length. Played without timing into the covers.

ah, that releases the pressure. Top shot from Dilshan, but Southee helped the cause with an ill-directed bouncer. Angles in and sits up nicely at waist high, Dilshan pummels it along to backward square leg for his 50th World Cup 2011 boundary.
short of a length on off stump, Dilshan gets behind the line comfortably and defends

another poor short ball, and Dilshan plays his best shot of the evening so far. Poor direction again, slipping down the leg side though there was extra effort in it this time. Dilshan rolled the wrists over it as he kept it down along square leg for a day.
fuller length on off stump, Dilshan plays it into the covers with assurance as he gets forward.
full length from round the wicket, Sanga's feet are moving better. He plays it into the covers off the front foot.
short of a length outside off, but no room whatsoever. Dilshan still has a humongous swing at the carved cut, but can't beat point
offcutter comes in from outside off, Dilshan stays put on the crease and whips it square for a single.
drifts into the pads this time, Sanga clips it neatly to fine leg for a single

Dilshan survives a leading edge. Offcutter stops and bounces extra from short of a length and Dilshan is squared up as he goes into an early flick. Leading edge pops up to the off side of the pitch, and spends an eternity before coming down.
fuller and straighter on the stumps, Dilshan plays it in front of square carefully
tossed up well outside off, Sanga leans out to defend
on middle and leg this time, worked with the spin to the leg side.
length ball on middle, Sanga defends from the crease down the track.
Sanga gets a single, working with the spin through wide mid on for a single.
fuller and on the pads, Dilshan on-drives without timing to the leg side
turn from middle and leg, played into the off side with the spin.
short of a length on off stump, defended into the off side by Sanga.

Sanga. He's played the kind of cover drive you want to take a snap of, convert into a sepia-tinted wall paper and show the kids, years from now.. Guptill at cover misfields, but lets disregard that for a moment. Length ball outside off, Sanga gets forward, goes down on a knee and compels the ball through the covers. Thing of beauty.
back of a length, and wisely so. Sanga defends from the crease.
similar ball, Sanga stays back and plays it back down the track
aha, once again Oram gets one to go away off the seam and he nearly has Sanga on a lazy poke away from the body.
short of a length on off stump to end the over, Sanga defends from the crease down the track.
back of a length on off stump, Dilshan defends with sure feet and hard hands
flatter and straighter, Dilshan is again behind the line as he defends down the track.
loopy delivery, lands on leg and breaks away, Dilshan gets the front foot down instead of across, opening up the off side and drives a single into the covers.
Sanga leans into the pitch and works Vettori with the spin through midwicket
short ball outside off, Dilshan goes for the cut but it stays low.
tantalisingly slow and looped up on middle, Dilshan goes for the sweep in slow motion and just gets some bat on it. McCullum was appealing for lbw, though.
Ryder's on the move once again. He's horizontal at point after throwing himself into the path of a spanking Dilshan square drive as McKay angles one across full and wide.
McKay gets one to come in off the seam. Or was that reverse? 142 kph as Sanga punches from the crease to mid off. Dilshan wants a single, and has to hurry back in as mid off struggles to pick it
short of a length on middle, Sanga's behind the line as he defends down the track.

very optimistic appeal from McKay, but he's working up some pace now. 143 kph and prodigious inward movement on that from over the wicket, hit Sanga's toes on the move as he missed the flick, but it was going well down the leg side
holds this one back of a length and Sanga gets inside the line to glance a single backward of square leg
fuller ball to end the over, Dilshan works it away to mid on.
great delivery after the break, but it's safely negotiated. Looped up on middle, gripping and spinning away, but Dilshan nudges it down behind gully for one all the same
Kumar wanders out of his crease, taking the ball on the half volley and sending it down to long-on
"catch!" shouts Vettori as Dilshan cuts and is very nearly beaten by the extra bounce, the ball looping towards backward point but dropping in front of him. That was close
extra bounce again from Vettori, but Dilshan steps back and punches to cover for a single this time. A less aggressive shot than the last
tossed up, defended by Sangakkara
very full once again, Sangakkara leans into a drive but perhaps tries to over-hit it, and the shot goes nowhere
good line from McKay, the ball spitting off a length to beat the outside edge
straighter this time, nudged defensively into the leg side
dug in short by McKay, Dilshan slaps down on the ball but can't beat cover
slower ball this time, an offcutter, and again Dilshan pushes into the off side. Not many gaps in this field
quick and full on off stump, Dilshan stands still and flashes to point. He just can't beat this field
on a length and straight to finish, Dilshan pushes to mid-on. A maiden for McKay, New Zealand need to string a couple of them together and build some pressure
Styris labours to the crease and lobs down an offcutter, cracked out to deep cover
much too short at this gentle pace, this really sat up and Dilshan was in no hurry rocking back and thumping a pull behind square
flicked away for a single to follow up the big shot
Sangakkara comes forward and taps into space at cover for one
Dilshan stays deep in the crease and works to midwicket
that's the length and the line Styris needs to stick to, landing on off stump and cutting back in. Dilshan drives, but with no great authority, and Styris gives him the ol' crazy eye
that is all class from Sangakkara, leaning forward with perfect balance and aiming a checked-drive straight down the ground. The ball really pinged off the middle, timed to perfection
McKay responds by digging this one in much shorter, Sangakkara steps back and defends infront of his chest
fuller, wobbling around on off stump and Sangakkara comes forward to defend to the off side
a touch of extra bounce outside off, but there's also some width. Sangakkara can't take full toll, however, tapping to backward point
bouncer from McKay, and a good one. Sangakkara is a cool customer, however, and buckles his knees in good time
back of a length to finish, Sangakkara defends off the splice of the bat to cover
inswinger rather than offcutter to start, and Dilshan stands at the crease to punch into the off side
indecision in the running! Sangakkara and Dilshan both missed a step and then ran ... but the throw is wild and both would've been home anyway
good length from Styris, right up to the bat. The ball takes the inside half of the blade and rolls into the off side, and they steal a quick single. There's the fifty stand
lobbed up gently on middle, cutting away and Sangakkara defends
slightly wider of off stump this time, Sangakkara opens the face of the bat on the drive to pick up one to gully

well bowled! Offcutter on the perfect length, Dilshan just stands there and holds the bat out - the feet didn't move an inch - and a thick inside edge shoots past the stumps and rolls down to fine leg
full on off stump, cracked out through the covers by Dilshan
definite wobble through the air for McKay as he pitches one up on off stump. Sangakkara responds with a stylish square drive, but it's stopped by Ryder at point
very short indeed from McKay, the ball balloons miles over the batsman and that's definitely a wide
fielding! New Zealand enhance their reputation as a fielding unit even further as How leaps to his right at cover point to stop another scything drive from Sangakkara
back of a length on off stump, pushed firmly back to the bowler
driven in the air! But Sangakkara threads the gap at extra cover perfectly, and that was powerfully struck too
tapped towards mid-off, who is a little deep, and they sprint through for a quick single
Oram comes round the wicket, angling it in, and Sangakkara glances off the hip down to fine leg
too short from Oram at medium pace, Dilshan leans back and smites this over deep midwicket! Big shot
back of a length once again, Dilshan pushes to point
that's the length, fuller and straighter. Dilshan stands there in line with leg stump and defends to cover

smashed to cover, and a misfield gives him four! Typical Dilshan shot, he stepped forward to a wide half-volley but didn't bother getting the front foot anywhere near the ball, just swiping the bat through the line. Guptill in the covers should've stopped that, but the ball bursts past him. And I'd just been talking up their fielding!
tame end to the over, Dilshan defends quietly into the off side
tossed up on the toes, Sangakkara just places the ball to square leg for an easy single
McCullum comes round the wicket to Dilshan, who thumps a full ball down to long-on for a single
Sangakkara looks for the little dink into the leg side, but the ball goes nowhere
quality ball from McCullum, pitching on middle and spinning away. Sangakkara treats it with respect, defending solidly
a touch to full on leg stump, nudged to the man at midwicket
Sangakkara jumps out of the crease, turning the delivery into a full toss and thwacking it to the deep midwicket boundary!

Dilshan never looks that solid in defence, the way he leaves his stumps exposed, and such is the case here as he pushes back to Oram. If that ball had cut a touch more either way he might've been in trouble
slightly wider of off, forced into the covers
Dilshan cuts well behind square, but picks out Ryder with precision!

on a length and wide of off, Dilshan flings everything at it and the ball takes a thick edge, bouncing down to the third man boundary for his sixth four! And that's yet another fifty for Dilshan too, he's having a great World Cup
fuller and straighter, Dilshan steps half forward and drives to mid-off
Oram bowls the bouncer, with McCullum Jr. standing up to the stumps, and Dilshan thinks about the upper cut ... but leaves alone. Good stop by the keeper, though he couldn't hold on cleanly
flighted very full on middle, Sangakkara digs it out to mid-on
arrowed down the leg side

Sangakkara charges out of his crease but perhaps gets too close to it, digging it out to cover ... and they'll get an overthrow here! Taylor at short extra cover stopped the bowl and for some reason under-armed it at the non-strikers end, where Dilshan had his bat grounded. Sloppy
swept very hard, and all along the ground, but straight to the man at long leg
again Sangakkara uses his feet, getting nicely to the pitch and lifting the ball cleanly back over McCullum's head with power and grace! That takes him past 400 runs in the tournament
defended this time
and solid defence to end the over, another good one for Sri Lanka
very full, drifting in, and Dilshan digs it out back to the bowler
this wasn't all that short but Dilshan stepped right back and across, cutting off the off stump to pick up two behind square
tossed up slower, this time Dilshan leans forward to defend
Vettori slips towards leg stump, and is flicked through square leg for a couple. Easy runs there, massive gaps
this time Vettori is too short, Dilshan hangs back and slams a pull up and over midwicket
full outside off, well-driven but it goes straight to the man at short extra cover, on the bounce
Sangakkara taps towards a deepish mid-off and sets off straight away for a sprinted single, good calling
this one hit the pitch and moved back in to Dilshan, who tapped it gently towards midwicket for a single
a classical shot! That didn't even look like beating the field but it was placed perfectly between cover and mid-off, once it beat the bat the great timing took full effect and it raced away
on a length and nicely straight, Sangakkara defends
Sangakkara looks to drive on the up once again, but this time the timing and placement are not quite there. Stopped at extra cover
fuller, driven to mid-off
nicely driven, but Ryder does really well at backward point, diving to his right to cut it off
looped up very temptingly outside off, Dilshan doesn't take the bait though, leaving alone
cracked away on the cut! Dilshan beats the field and collects another boundary. Is there any stopping this man?
again Dilshan cuts, this time to the field
Vettori definitely bowling to a plan here with those two catchers, again he flights one outside off, but Dilshan is determined not to make any mistakes and leaves alone again
fuller and straighter to finish, Dilshan defends
Southee continues, Sangakkara punching away to point
good length from Southee, and he's found a nice line on off stump, giving Sangakkara no width. Pushed to mid-off this time
a touch straighter, this time Sangakkara nudges to midwicket. This has been a good over so far. Big shot coming?
not yet, again Southee hits a length on off stump and Sangakkara nudges to point

was that the chance? Slower ball from Southee, pitched up, and Sangakkara mis-reads it, popping the ball back in the air ... but the luck is with him, it goes wide of the bowler who tries to swivel across in his follow-through
Southee ends a superb over with another accurate length delivery, which Sangakkara nudges into the leg side
much too short, the ball sits up and Dilshan hammers a pull to deep midwicket. Didn't bother keeping it down, and there's the 150
driven hard down to long-off for one
not all that short, and keeping a touch low too, but Sangakkara was determined to play this on the back foot, pulling to midwicket
fuller on off stump, tapped into the off side
Sangakkara steps out and sends the ball racing down to long-on for one

that wasn't far from the off stump! Looped up by Vettori, who is still bowling to that plan with two catchers close in around cover point, and Dilshan leaves alone ... but the ball didn't turn and that wasn't too far
fifty for Sangakkara! Too straight from Southee, and the batsman rolls his wrists on the glance to send the ball out to deep square leg
Dilshan was keen for the pull but the ball didn't quite warrant it, and a toe-ended shot goes nowhere

Southee searches for some swing by pitching this one up, but Dilshan responds by flinging the bat into a wild drive to send the ball scorching to the cover boundary ... and actually, that looked like a slower ball, an offcutter

finally New Zealand break through! Dilshan was looking to end this in a hurry, slashing at a length delivery to give Ryder an easy catch. It's probably come too late for his team, but that'll give some consolation at least
Southee is suitably pumped-up by a wicket and shoves in a short ball that Jayawardene barely raises an eyebrow at
Jayawardene is away with a routine tuck to leg

well, well. Stunned silence in the crowds as Jayawardene is given out lbw. He popped forward to a straight delivery, played around a straight ball and was struck in front. Decent stride and a review but the ball is hitting!
goodness me! This zips through past the inside edge of a nervous poke outside off
hint of air and spin and Samaraweera is cagey in defence
more solid this time, Samaraweera steps forward to block
sprawling, diving stop from Nathan McCullum at mid-off saves a boundary from crisp drive
tossed up and Sangakkara rushes down the track to meet it, almost ends up yorking himself. Vettori almost has a spring in his step! He's been rather grumpy most of the day
not a great start this, short and down the leg side. Whipped off the hip around the corner
there is some swing here, not much, but the line and length are good enough to prevent runs
print that in a textbook. Lovely shot. Overpitched admittedly, but Sangakkara leant into a cover drive and dreamily timed it to the rope
a bouncer from McKay, Sangakkara ducks under it
good-looking drive from Sangakkara, doesn't beat short cover however, it was a length ball just outside off
an arm ball from Vettori, hurries on to Samaraweera, who stays on the back foot and defends towards off
gets forward this time, and blocks towards point
tossed up by Vettori, bounced a touch more, hits the splice of the bat as Samaraweera defends off the front foot
more forward defence from Samaraweera
this one skids on after pitching on a length outside off, Samaraweera sensibly defends, he's decided to see off Vettori's over
flighted once more, and width provided, Samaraweera looks to drive towards extra cover but mishits it along the ground to the left of the bowler for a single
back of a length and angling across, tapped towards backward point

massive wicket this, Sangakkara holes out to third man, the party comes to a halt in Colombo, it was a short ball just outside off, Sangakkara uppercuts it, but he can only find third man, anyone else thinking of the SA-NZ quarter-final?
Silva's first ball is defended towards gully
short of length ball just outside off, blocked from the crease to the off side, plenty of tense faces in the Colombo crowd now
length ball outside off, Silva wafts at it and misses
end of a good over from McKay, no room at all for the batsman, this was on middle stump, Silva gets behind the line and defends
Samaraweera gets forward and opens the face off the first ball of Oram's over
more careful defence from Samaraweera
Oram keeps it simple, good old-fashioned length bowling outside off, punched towards cover off the front foot
length ball again, on middle stump this time, Samaraweera mistimes it towards mid-on
a touch shorter and just outside off, whipped behind square leg for a single
short of length ball, in the channel outside off, solidly defended off the front foot
slanting across the batsman, gets the edge as he tries to poke at it with soft hands, dribbles past vacant second slip for a single
overpitched ball just outside off, played not too confidently towards gully
lovely delivery from McKay, Silva is drawn towards it and he looks to push it towards cover, no footwork at all as he plays that, he gets nowhere near the ball
and the runs aren't coming for Sri Lanka now, just outside off and it is defended towards backward point
short ball, 141 kmh, flies over the ducking Silva, was that was high enough to be a wide? the umpire doesn't think it is
gets forward and opens the face to steer the ball through second slip, Silva's off the mark
Oram keeps it tight, a short of length ball on offstump, forward defensive from Silva
mistimed drive off the front foot towards mid-off, Oram keeps it back of a length and just outside off
and another dot ball, Silva is 1 off 13 now, Oram sends this one on middle stump, defended to the leg side
length ball on off, punched towards mid-on, Silva sets off for the single, before being sent back, nervous times these for the batsmen
short and wide, first time Silva is getting this much room, he carves it behind backward point and sprints back for the second, taking on the throw from Kane Williamson in the deep
length ball just outside off, opens the face to defend the ball towards point
short of length and outside off, dabbed towards cover by Samaraweera
a swinging full toss that just curves away from offstump, Samaraweera tries an uncharacteristically flamboyant shot, looking to swing that over cover, doesn't connect
gets bat on ball this time, a wristy shot worked the ball towards fine leg
shortish ball just outside off, Silva stays on the backfoot and guides the ball past gully and towards third man
a full ball on middle stump, clipped towards midwicket by Samaraweera
overpitched pitch angling into middle, pushed towards mid-on, only two off that over and it's now 42 needed off 54
short of length ball is defended watchfully
keeps it steady and just outside off, blocked to the off side
mistimes the attempted drive towards cover, the ball goes nowhere
there's the boundary Sri Lanka were searching for, a half-volley well outside off, crunched past a diving Jacob Oram at point
cheeky, that's four more, just outside off, Silva opens the face and gets it just  wide of the keeper, eight off two balls and relief for Sri Lanka
and again Silva steers the ball towards short third man for a single
bit of width offered, Silva cuts that but not past a diving fielder at point, crowd volume starting to go up again

bowled him, the crowd silenced once more, Silva is cleaned up by Southee, these New Zealand chaps never know when they are beaten, it was a short of length ball well outside off, Silva chased after it, his attempted cut ends in a bottom-edge that drags the ball back on to the leg stump, New Zealand can't stop grinning, they are enjoying themselves out there
length ball heading for off, confident defence from Mathews, he's the key man for Sri Lanka now, he has a solid temperament, don't think it has been tested on a bigger stage than this
length ball outside off, left alone by Mathews
back of a length ball on off, Mathews gets behind the line and blocks
into the blockhole from Southee, Mathews gets his feet out of the way and digs the ball out towards midwicket, what an over from Southee, wicket maiden
length ball that is defended towards square leg
a slog from Samaraweera, and it fetches him a boundary, a short of length ball outside off, heaved to deep midwicket by Samaraweera
defended towards the off side by Samaraweera, he decides there's no need for anything flash after that shot
blocked towards backward point
driven firmly to the right of Southee at short cover, who dives and gets a hand on the ball but can't stop it, a single is taken
length ball to end the over, calmly played towards midwicket

Samaraweera gets three by flicking the length ball towards deep midwicket, a long chase for Jacob Oram while allows the time for three, the throw from Oram is way over the keeper's head and that's an overthrow, uncharacteristically sloppy from New Zealand
a bouncer from Southee, batsman ducks
length ball outside off, Samaraweera gets forward and defends the ball towards backward point
another bouncer, Samaraweera gets onto the front foot and has some trouble evading that one, ducks under in time though, he's bemused that  it wasn't called a wide
slants onto the legstump, whipped towards deep backward square leg for a single, easy run that
another bouncer to end the over, Mathews takes his eyes off the ball as he pulls, mistimed towards midwicket, wide enough of the fielder to get a single
no footwork from Mathews as he dabs a ball angling across him to backward point
a short ball on legstump, Mathews gets back and tucks the ball behind square leg, no effort to power it, just guides it for a single
well outside off, that's easy for Samaraweera, he guides it down to third man
oh dear, that could be the game, five wides down the leg side, a diving Brendon McCullum can't get that in his gloves and Sri Lanka's 200 comes up

hang on, it might not be over, referral after umpire turned down an appeal for caught-behind, New Zealand are very confident, but without Snicko it is very difficult to overturn the decision, very hard to tell from the replays whether there is a deflection, and unless Mathews has really thwacked that it will be difficult to pick up an edge, and to no one's surprise, Mathews survives, no noise or deviation perceptible in the replays
length ball angling across, solidly defended from the crease towards the cover
a short ball from McKay, pulled by Mathews, timing is terrible, the ball just dribbles towards midwicket, still enough on it to get a single

Mathews! what a shot that is, Sri Lanka take a giant step towards the final with a superbly timed lofted on-drive that sails into the crowd, it was a length ball wanting to be hit and it's a six off the first ball, Colombo loves it!
down the leg side and that is off Mathews' body to the keeper

Mathews is injured, but that doesn't show as he skates down the track and launches the ball over the bowler's head, a one-bounce four and Sri Lanka are a hit away from a second successive World Cup final, Mathews shows what a cool head he has once again
length ball outside off, gets forward and blocks towards the off side
shortish ball into the midriff, Mathews looks to pull and swivels as he plays the shot, can't get bat on it and is hit on the body
another short ball from Southee, Mathews skips towards leg and mistimes a pull towards midwicket
length ball outside off, calmly steered towards third man for a single
shortish and on legstump, worked to square leg to bring Sri Lanka within one of New Zealand's score, the decibel level is high now in Colombo
swishes at that one outside off without any footwork, looking to steer it to third man, he misses

bowled from wide of the crease, angling in, Samaraweera looks to short-arm that behind square leg, Jayawardene is screaming off the blocks for a single before he realises Samaraweera is going nowhere and turns back

Sri Lanka book their tickets to Mumbai, their second final in a row, what an achievement this is. not the finest shot to seal the win, an outside edge between the keeper and a wide slip for four, they don't care, it's party-time in Sri Lanka, this is going to be the first all-Asian World Cup final, credit to New Zealand, they fought hard and made it tense for a while in the chase, but Sri Lanka were too good for them today
